snippet: President Hamid Karzai’s appointment of five new human rights commissioners has drawn criticism from inside and outside the country.
abstract: Afghan Pres Hamid Karzai's appointment of five new human rights commissioners has become sore point with countries that support Afghanistan financially; donor nations and United Nations plan to call for Karzai to reconsider appointments, who have been widely criticized by human rights and women's activists.
lead_paragraph: President Hamid Karzai’s appointment of five new human rights commissioners has drawn criticism from inside and outside the country.

headline.main: Donors Are Likely to Ask Karzai to Rethink Rights Panel Choices
headline.print_headline: Donors Are Likely to Ask Karzai To Rethink Rights Panel Choices

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
